Half-Life Deathmatch: Source SUCKS

why?

well were are
10 REASONS (and an extra) ON WHY YOU SHOULDN'T BUY THIS GAME:
1. buggy
2. weapons don't behave like in the original (for the worse)
3. extra disc space waste
4. bad framerate
5. inconsistent sound effects
6. inconsistent hitboxes 
7. buying this just for gmod isn't worth it
8. constant lag
9. the original DM works better in general, and it is more stable. plus it comes with the campaign
10. the soul reason: the multiplayer is mostly dead

EXTRA: the game looks awful, BECAUSE it just doesn´t feel right. Half life 1 has in my opinion a timeless artstyle but this game grabs the old textures and outdated models and better, yet, not truly realistic shaders mixing them into something that makes me want to puke. It just doesn't feel right

CONCLUSION: this game is an absolute piece of shit, don't bother even looking at it, you are better putting your hand into a blender.

Man, this game  f u c k i n g   s u c k s. Why? Valve just thought:"s h i t, let's just make Steampipe patch for all our Source games but we not gonna test anything, not gonna test compatibility and stuff. Players will test". I tested. Half-Life Deathmatch: Source treats players like garbage while being garbage itself.

You think you can use tau cannon in a same way you've been using it for all these years in Hl1 deathmatch? No, game says:"sorry, man, 98% of surfaces will damage you hard if you'll try to use gauss on them". Wanna use tau to get on the roof? You'll get 1000 damage. Wanna shoot enemy through wall? Wall gonna turn you into gibs. Not like in hl1, where there were like 3 or 4 walls damagin' you. Too easy! Let's turn it into a lottery, where 9 walls out of 10 will kick your  a s s  if you shoot them. B u l l s h i t.

Mp5 nade now has damage radius of nuclear bomb. You see explosion of the nade on the other side of the map - next second your dead body rotating 360 degrees in the  f u c k i n g  air.

Hitboxes have turned into complete  s h i t s h o w. Sometimes you make double-barrel shot from Spas12 while enemy is 1 meter away but somehow he survives and, what's is even better, doesn't take any damage! Wonderful, right? And sometimes you get hit by shotgun from kilometer range (and you have 100 health and 100 armor) and die instantly. "Kiss my  a s s! No fair play here!" - said HLDM:S.

Xbow is the worst weapon in the universe now because if you made a shot from it when you were 25 years old, the bolt will hit target once you are 95. Also xbow has dumb camera shaking after each shot, which is very annoying when you are in zoom mode. Epilepsy warning!

Crowbar can't hit  s h i t when you hitting a moving enemy while also moving your character. You hear hit sounds but surprise - no damage dealt! Game just laughs at your pathetic attempts to kill someone with melee weapon.

Unless you playing on a server with a custom .cfg you will encounter all of this  s h i t (and even more). It's not a very good thing when to actually play the game you have to join custom servers or change a lot of stuff in cfg of yours. Oh, and also to change playermodel, you have to bind the model you want in console. You need to do it EVERY time you launch game. F u c k i n g  menu doesn't work when you try to change model in it. So most of the time you'll see gordons running around trying to have fun in this trash game.

I didn't recommend Half-Life: Source and I definitely won't be recommending its multiplayer counterpart either. This game (which strangely came out two years after the Source port for the single player aspect) is like a prototype for Half-Life 2 Deathmatch. After the disaster of Half-Life: Source it's mind-boggling to think why Valve were so keen to release a multiplayer add-on. Despite the improvements of the Source engine over time - see Half-Life 2 Episode One, which came out around the same time - this game still feels wonky and a bit broken like the main game. The servers seem to all have bad latency no matter what, the rag-dolls are stiff and somewhat petrified-looking... and just to remind you that Valve don't give two turds about this game, you can't switch player model skins without tampering around in the developer console. Nice.  
So, will I recommend this game? Absolutely not. Even if you aren't a fan of Goldsource games, at least they're more heavily populated and (sort of) receive a little bit more acknowledgement from their creators. The original Half-Life is still a far superior experience. 
Half-Life Deathmatch: Source has no good reason to exist. It really is just another generic shooter that Valve threw together simply because they could. And, not that I hold it in much of a high regard, Half-Life 2 Deathmatch is the way to go for a "real" Half-Life multiplayer game.
It also doesn't have weapons that look as though they've been licked clean and polished for about forty years. So there's that, too.
